snippet: Citing news accounts, the lawyer for Naeem Davis said the Queens man who was shoved onto the tracks might have been drunk and harassing his client.
abstract: Lawyer for Naeem Davis, man charged with pushing Ki-Suck Han onto a Manhattan subway track, where he was struck and killed by train, says that his client’s actions might have been justified because Han had been drinking and was harassing him; witnesses accounts describe Han's actions as 'problematical,' with some saying that Han smelled of alcohol, was staggering and following Davis.
lead_paragraph: Citing news accounts, the lawyer for Naeem Davis said the Queens man who was shoved onto the tracks might have been drunk and harassing his client.

headline.seo: Fatal Push in Subway May Have Been Justified, Lawyer Says
headline.main: Lawyer Posits Justification in Fatal Push in Subway
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Says Fatal Push in Subway May Have Been Justified
